comment: As someone who graduated a year ago and am now in grad school taking anatomy again i assure you he is not a good professor anatomy wise. My grad school professors have absolutely showed me that. If he still does powerpoint with no words then i promise u avoid him at all cost! You will do more self teaching than him teaching

definitely go to class and read over power point notes. He goes over material fast and goes deeply in depth with his lessons but overall good teach and knows how to engage the class. the course overload isn't much you just have to study and make sure you listen in class to get good grades. tests are difficult cause he makes his own. He's good!!

To get an A in the class, just show up. In-class activities are easy and don't take much time or effort, and the "final" is a group project of completing a partially pre-made poster for an experiment that he provides the data for. There's no homework at all. But, he can be snippy or tell weird stories that make the vibe of the class a bit awkward.

I understand where people are coming from about how it is hard, but I feel that if you pay attention in class, he teaches well and has funny dad jokes/stories to help you remember parts of the body. He's a great guy, I've talked to him outside class, and was accommodating when I had a concussion, and would check in on me in the weeks following it.

I had an awful experience with this instructor. He had limited office hours, didn't respond to emails, and refused extensions or extra credit. His lectures and text were excessive for a one-credit class. Due to his lack of communication and rigid policies, I withdrew from the course. Avoid his class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment:
He was sweet, responded to emails, ands had an amnesty day for turning in missing assignments the day before finals.
It's a silly class to have to take, but he makes it fun. You don't need to put 100% effort into everything, but turn everything in.
All the assignments are easy, but boring. Good resources to have & look back on though.

Attendance is mandatory since he randomly takes in class attendance. I loved him!! Regardless of his reviews, he cared when you asked questions and was always there to help. His powerpoints are all pictures so read lab textbook, watch videos, and GO OVER HIS SLIDES & STUDY GUIDES, they help you!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Test heavy

comment: attendance is mandatory especially because you never know when there's an in class assignments which can and will help boost your grade. class is pretty easy as long as you keep up with work and notes and study + doing homework... overall, I recommend taking his class.

Definitely need to do a little bit of reading before the lectures just for some background info, but he does a great job at explaining things and painting the picture in your head. He wants you to succeed and it shows. Attendance wasn't mandatory, he would randomly do in class assignments for extra credit and usually added a curve to every test.

If you intake anything else, let me EMPHASIZE how enforced attendance is... your grade depends on it. The coursework is easy. and make sure you choose wisely in who you sit with- they will be with you for the semester in group assignments and ... but this class should be an easy A.

Had him for CSM and he was very easy and an overall chill professor. Pretty much everything was done in group projects and attendance was a really big thing. If you didn't show up you didn't pass. Gave lots of extra credit opportunities.

Just took anatomy for the summer. Wasn't a bad class but read read read the textbooks. His lecture is not enough to pass. I got away with the C due to failing 4/5 exams and making a 85 on final. I had A's in everything else. Go to class for LC grade, easy 100.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy

comment: I took this class in the summer. The class was unnecessary to go to, but had to go because of learning catalytic. 4 tests and a comprehensive final, gave extra credit after each test. Uses PowerPoint with no words. You teach yourself. Gives an overall summary study guide from the textbook. Nice guy.

I was terrified to take this class. The reviews are correct in regards to his lectures just being pictures. He provides study guides for each test so if you do that and read the text book i passed every test. He also offered a ton of extra credit per test that helped bump my grade to an A. Just be diligent with your studying and you should be fine

This was the first B I have ever received in a course. I thought I could out study the reviews I had read, but definitely not. The only thing that will help you for his tests is reading the textbook repeatedly, but even still they are nearly impossible. Very rude, treats you like you are stupid, and barely teaches. Not willing to help anyone.

I took him a year ago and left with an C. he is horrible at teaching just simply dont take him. I retook it with parente this semester and are currently at an  90 in his class with a week left. Take parente and use SI sessions and your good or someone else with good reviews. This professor should not be an option if he is the only one left, wait!

I loved this professor! His lectures were not really helpful due to him getting distracted and telling stories, but overall the tests were not too hard and he gives a lot of extra credit. Attendance is not mandatory but he does give a lot of the extra credit in class so it's really up to you to show up. Super nice guy and very entertaining.

Mr. Schneider is not a good teacher. He blames the students, makes you feel dumb when asking questions, and isn't available to talk to students via email. I only emailed him once and he never got back to me. If you can avoid him at all costs, I would! If you have to take him, just use the textbook to study!
THE ABSOLUTE WORST.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: I am honestly advising you DO NOT take his class. Attendance is mandatory because there is this thing called a learning catalyst you will do in almost every class. His lectures are boring and you have to teach yourself the material or YOU WILL struggle. He is also very petty.

Worst professor at the beginning, I think there was a learning curve for him. He made a lot of mistakes and owned up to some of them. Not accessible outside of class, cancelled office hours a lot. Expect mastering work but less than other teachers gave. Be prepared to teach yourself, tests will feel near impossible. Lectures are just powerpoint.

bad prof at first. Listened to our complaints and changed. Very homework based class. Quizlet based questions. Very difficult content, and lots of it. Prof is a sweet guy. Towards the end he made it easy for us to pass. He grew on me for sure. Lots of curves.Tests online w lockdown. Lectures sometimes off topic. Groupwork randomly, come to class.

This is a hard course no matter your proff. He offers many bonus opportunities if you're in class and the practice test is kinda like the exam. He tells you to look up the practice questions, so do. If you get him it will not be the end of the world, just be prepared to study and go to class and you'll be fine. Again, know the practice tests

I wish that I had waited to take this class with a different professor. I had to teach myself using the textbook for the entire class as he would waste time in EVERY class lecturing us on how we needed to be in class and not to cheat. The lecture really doesn't match up well with what you are tested on, as he rambles a lot.

I would definitely not recommend this professor unless you are a FAST learner or have some memorization technique. There was a test almost every 3 weeks and hardly enough time was given to actually learn the content. His lectures didn't help me at all and most days, I was only in class for the extra points.

Perhaps the worst professor I have ever had in my entire college career. I dropped within the first few weeks of class, right after the first exam, because I could tell this was gonna decimate my GPA. Has no idea what he's doing and doesn't seem to actually care about classes. Literally didn't even understand MyMastering and was preachy.

He's a nice and enthusiastic guy, but as a teacher he is very tough. His lectures aren't the best as the slides just consist of pictures and diagrams along with a caption in the top left which contains information that won't even be presented on the exam. Be prepared to self teach, and use the practice tests A LOT.

DON'T TAKE HIM!!! He rumbles on for about 15-20 mins in the beginning of class about nothing that has to do with the lecture (Ex: Football, Music, basically his hobbies). Tests are very hard (You'll have 50 mins or less to complete 65-70 multiple choice questions) and I believe there are 4 or 5 of them. You have been warned. Goodluck!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: He is awesome. I would recommend him to anyone

He was really nice, very goofy, but those tests were not it. I would put in 25+ hours of studying on my own a week outside the class and the highest test grade i have gotten in the class was an 88. It is a hard class, but he could have included better lecture slides. He gives a lot of extra credit so show up to every class, its how i passed.

Dr. Schneider is a tough professor for an already challenging class to teach. You need to read the textbook and take the practice tests at least 20 times until you feel comfortable with all the terms. If you don't know the words in the answer choices on the practice, write them down somewhere and look up what each means.

Nice guy but the class is basically self-taught. If you have no other choice but to take him you MUST read the textbook chapter that he will go over in class BEFORE going to class. Take notes from the textbook and study your notes. The tests come straight from the textbook-I cannot stress that enough.&Do the practice exams as many times as possible
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: My tutor is someone already in PT school and he said my tests/homework were harder than his. I went from averaging a 60 on the tests to getting a 95 on my first Anatomy 2 test. Only positive is that every other class is a joke compared to his
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: For the Love of everything do NOT take this class save yourself!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Lectures are just him talking about random stuff and he expects you to know what the tests are even if he does't teach the material. The tests are super detailed and in go in to. the smallest details of material we barely cover. Take someone else for you're own sake.

his lectures suck and like someone else said, they will always include some motivational speech. Attendance is mandatory and graded, if you walk in late to class there is a chance he will point you out in front of all hundred other students about how being late reflects your grade. exams are insanely impossible to pass no matter how hard you study.
Very difficult tests, way too hard for what is supposed to be an easy class. Only C I’ve ever gotten in my life. I took his class in 2019 and the tests were super difficult.
No Extra credit, PowerPoint are just pictures, basically have to teach yourself, practice tests werent helpful. Not much of a great professor overall.

Prof. Schnieder is a good choice if you are good at self-studying. You need to be prepared for the lecture by reading ahead or it won't make sense. He has practice exams, doing those HELP A LOT!! Other grades include Homeworks, Reviews, Learning Cataclytics (In-class), and a couple of extra Credits he throws in here and there.

sweet guy but a horrible teacher. Asks for feedback and when he gets it says "good point, but I'm not changing." Has powerpoints that are nothing but pictures from the textbook and starts rambling expecting you to write everything as he says it. Attendance isn't mandatory but has "pop attendance checks" in the form of learning catalytics.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I was struggling a lot in this class, so I went to his office hours for help. I did everything he told me to do, but I still did not do well on any of his tests or labs. I would not recommend his class. I had to retake this and did a different teacher, and ended up getting a B with the other professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Not a very good professor. Hell give a useless motivational speech before hell even attempt to actually help you. Tests are nothing like what he teaches. If this class is your only choice, all I can say is work your butt off. Treat this class as if it was your only one (because thats the only way youll get the grade you want.)

I had to teach my self the entire class. His lectures dont help at all and he doesnt know how to instruct you on what to do. Any questions you ask are vaguely answered if at all. Would never recommend taking his class.

I would NEVER take this man again. On the second exam the class average was a 58%. The highest grade was a 88 ( out of 200 people) that should tell you everything you need to know. I studied for hours and hours just to retake this class with someone else. If you have to take him GOOD LUCK.

No ppts for lectures, he hand writes them during class. TON OF INFORMATION. READ THE BOOK TO PAST. Tests are extremely in-depth so know your stuff. WORK HARD if you want a good grade. Try to take another professor if possible.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Course lecture does not truly correspond to the complexity of the tests. Expects a high degree of knowledge in the subject but there are no pre-requisite. Practice tests but does not give feedback. Avg test grades are in the 60s and he is proud of it. Other work available to support grades.

I took him for lab and I felt he was great. Anatomy lab is tough but he is very encouraging and tells you exactly what will be on the test. I feel his tests were very fair and that he does want students to succeed. But, if you aren't trying he won't care. Also he is HILARIOUS! I was laughing every day in class. He is a great lab professor!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Lecture heavy

comment: Interesting lectures, you will learn a lot just by vaguely paying attention. He will help you out if he sees you trying.

Stay away!! his test are way too hard and its way too long to do in 50 minutes, rude, doesnt listen to students concerns about his teaching methods, he teaches from a powerpoint thats only pictures. i DO NOT recommend! i understand that this course is tough but he made it 1000x harder than what it had to be.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Awful prof! His test were extremely too hard & too long to do in 50 min. Disrespectful, doesnt listen to students concerns about his teaching methods. Little to no extra credit. If you want to pass A&P the 1st time please dont take him!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: This professor is by far the worst professor Ive encountered at KSU. His test are extremely too much and way too detailed. He doesnt respect nor listen to his students concerns about his teaching methods. By all means, Im no slacker in any of my classes and I usually make no lower than a B in my classes. But please steer clear of this class!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Schneider is a great and lenient grader for lab. He would record the modules for the lab ahead of time to make it easy. He is a bit slow when replying back to emails, but very understanding and will extend deadlines in situations. Easy A if you do the work. Lab included 4 quizzes, one paper, and final recorded presentation on a given topic.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: This was his first class fully online, he wouldn't take any constructive criticism, and when the whole class did poorly on a test, he blamed us and our study habits. His lectures consists of him talking the whole time and his powerpoints are only pictures. Lots of easy participation grades but test are very hard. Would not recommend.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: To be fair, Human Physiology is an incredibly tough course and the material is daunting but Professor Schneider does his best to integrate humor and personality into his lectures. His tests are incredibly difficult but it really makes sure that you know your material. If you take him, be prepared to study a lot but it'll pay off in the end.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: He's a friendly guy, but his tests were harder than he let on. He would hand write some of his notes in class which were not the neatest. His notes were also unorganized,and he admits to you that he is lazy about making powerpoint slides and about grading exams. If you must take him, I suggest you read the book and go over questions in the book.

Prof Schneider was mostly an easy professor. If you go to class you should do fine. However, he does do random attendance assignments that add up at the end. HE WILL NOT ROUND UP AT THE END OF THE SEMESTER! I got a C but .02 points and he would not round me up. Overall, a mediocre class.

Was suppose to be an easy A class but instead he makes it extremely complicated. His lectures only have pictures so when you go back to your notes, you missed a good amount of info. He's a great guy but as a professor, I would not want to take him again.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: terrible teacher. Worst professor i have taken at KSU, makes a simple science 1101 class way harder than it should be for some reason, should be an easy A or B for everyone because it is simple stuff but he makes you work for it. Absolutely awful lectures, they're just pictures/gifs on powerpoint slides with no words and he talks over it all class

He is SO unorganized. takes FOREVER to grade exams. Due to COVID-19 & classes being online, exams are through lockdown browser w webcam. I have a BIG problem w him allowing those w/o webcams to be pardoned. If everyone doesn't have one, YOU CANT REQUIRE OTHERS TO USE ONE. He expects you to know anatomy.. its not a prerequisite last time I checked
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Very funny and nice guy! His class was kinda hard to follow. I survived. Most us of all survived. This is college, things will be hard. Hes a good guy.

nice guy. quizzes can be hard. test be random, it either comes from the hw and other assignments or he pulls the questions from his butt. Study for the test. Go to office hours, It will help. You have to be in class to get credit for the daily assignment. So Person hw and lab quiz every week. 3 exams and a cumulative final.

This was his first semester at KSU and SHEEEEESH. His lecture slides are strictly pictures and he goes off on tangents about things irrelevant to the class and messes up answers on lab quizzes Do not even try to criticize his teaching skills because he will blame it on the class and be extremely passive-aggressive. Exams arent difficult but he is.

The lectures dont really relate to the material on the test. Read the textbook to do better on the tests. Attendance is taken as part of your grade and there is opportunity for extra credit if you go to more of the classes than required. Really nice and funny professor.

He didnt really seem to know how to teach. He really doesnt understand how the school system works. He repeatedly told the class we are competing for grades. I learned absolutely nothing from this class except that he doesnt actually care about the environment and is a do as I say not as I do type of teacher. Also good luck on the tests.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Considering he was a first time professor, Andy is not the worst professor, but not the best either. Classes are lectures (slides are pictures, so pay attention). Lab Quizzes and HW due weekly. Attendance not mandatory, but it counts as participation. Class was often boring, especially for those not interested in science. Chapter Outlines helped.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Hes a cool guy but a mediocre teacher (even though this can change). He definitely tries as he continuously accepts feedback and changes things about the class to make the experience better. The tests arent too hard as long as you know the key terms like the back of your hand. Attendance isnt mandatory but Id suggest it for easy points.

Dude is cheesier than fondue, but has a good heart & actually cares about your success not only in his class, but in college overall. His lectures were kinda boring & his PowerPoints don't have words, just pictures, but it helps to go to class because he clarifies a lot of stuff there. The tests could be tricky, especially the final.

TAKE HIM! People are complaining for no reason, he is great. I personally do not listening to lectures so I just sit in class and read the book. His lectures go in one ear and out the other. Talks about himself a bit (I went to Purdue!) and his personal experiences. Understands we are not science majors. Tests are fine, I average a B on them.

I'm a good student and had to drop his class he is a really nice and funny guy but lectures are him talking for an hour with pictures behind him, hard to follow along with and you never know what is on the tests. The class doesn't have too much structure and it's difficult to get good grades on the test, If you take him get ready to work hard.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Lecture heavy

comment: I do not understand why Professor Schneider is receiving so many bad reviews. He is hilarious (sometimes cheesy), and the class is not hard at all if you put effort into it. Tests were a bit difficult to me but thats probably because I dont study. Good professor.
Theres nothing wrong with him, hes just a new professor at KSU and hes defensive about it. Does give lots of extra credit which is nice

not a hard class; just not a fan of the prof - it was mostly annoying how much of a waste of time the lectures were when you could easily complete the quizzes/labs and excel on the exams without attending. just sit through class, do well on the online quizzes, read over the book/quizzes/mmes questions prior to exams, and you should be fine
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Anybody who rates this teacher as awful just must be lazy or really dumb. I suck at science, trust me. But Im making great grades in his class. Its actually easy. They just have to suck it up and do a bit of work. Do the lab, do your hw, show up for class, study for the test. That simple. He is MUCH better than any other science teacher. Trust me
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: I showed up for one class all semester and this guy is the reason why. I can't stand to be in his hot lecture hall listening to his pointless lectures. he is all over the place and can't focus on one topic. He also thinks he's hilarious but really he's super boring. Do not take his class.2

Super cool and funny guy, loves what he teaches and tries to make it enjoyable! Expensive and mandatory textbook code for class though, and you do weekly homework and pretty hard lab quizzes every week. Tests arent too bad if you use the Pearson study area and come to class for review before the test!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: This man is one of my favorite teachers this year!! If you do his work and study the textbook for the test, you will do great! He is super funny and gives a sort of "gimme grade" for just showing up to class. He cares a lot about his students so if you are struggling just ask him for help! I wish I could have him for 1102!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: THIS PROFESSOR ACTUALLY SUCKS!!! He is an awful professor. He doesn't teach anything really, nothing he says makes sense. You can study for his tests and still not pass! I would not recommend him to anyone
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader
